questions.text: A 50-year-old male underwent heart surgery for the prosthetic valve. Post-surgery he was started on warfarin therapy to prevent thromboembolic episodes. Which of the following statement is TRUE?

options.label: A
options.text: Sulphonamide displaces warfarin from the plasma protein binding site and increases the free drug concentration

options.label: B
options.text: Dose of warfarin to be reduced when administered along with barbiturates

options.label: C
options.text: Oral contraceptives decrease the clotting factors

options.label: D
options.text: Cimetidine induces the warfarin metabolism

questions.correct_answer: A. Sulphonamide displaces warfarin from the plasma protein binding site and increases the free drug concentration
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Sulphonamide displaces warfarin from the plasma protein binding site and increases the free drug concentration

Highyeild:

Sulphonamides, phenytoin, indomethacin, and probenecid displace warfarin from the plasma protein binding site and increase the free drug concentration The dose of warfarin is to be increased when administered along with barbiturates Oral contraceptives increase the clotting factors Cimetidine is an enzyme inhibitor, hence inhibiting the warfarin metabolism

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: B. Dose of warfarin to be reduced when administered along with barbiturates is a wrong statement. Option: C . Oral contraceptives decrease the clotting factors is a wrong statement. Option: D. Cimetidine induces warfarin metabolism is a wrong statement.

questions.text: 25-year-old pregnant woman in 1st trimester was suffering from venous thromboembolism and the treating doctor is planning to put her anticoagulant. Which of the following anticoagulant is safe in pregnancy?

options.label: A
options.text: Heparin

options.label: B
options.text: Warfarin

options.label: C
options.text: Nicoumalone

options.label: D
options.text: Rivaroxaban

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Heparin

Highyeild:

Heparin has a large molecular weight and is ionized, so it cannot cross the placental barrier and is safe during pregnancy Vitamin K antagonists are not used in pregnancy Rivaroxaban is used for prophylaxis of VTE after surgery

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: B. Warfarin is an oral anticoagulant that helps prevent the formation of harmful blood clots in the legs, lungs, brain, and heart. Option: C. NICOUMALONE belongs to a class of drugs known as anticoagulants or blood thinners. NICOUMALONE is primarily used to prevent and treat various types of thromboembolic diseases (blood clots inside blood vessels), including deep vein thrombosis (blood clots in leg veins) and pulmonary embolism (blood clots in the lung). Deep vein thrombosis is a medical condition in which blood clots form in deep veins, usually in the legs. Pulmonary embolism is a condition in which a blood clot blocks the arteries in the lungs. Option: D. Rivaroxaban is an oral anticoagulant that helps prevent the formation of harmful blood clots. It prevents the formation of blood clots in the legs, lungs, brain, and heart.

questions.text: Among the following options, which one is false about plasma protein binding of drugs:

options.label: A
options.text: Acidic drugs bind to albumin and basic drugs to alpha 1 acid glycoprotein

options.label: B
options.text: Free drug has high Vd

options.label: C
options.text: Highly protein-bound drugs may be removed by dialysis

options.label: D
options.text: Protein-bound drugs may undergo displacement reactions

questions.correct_answer: C. Highly protein-bound drugs may be removed by dialysis
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Highly protein-bound drugs may be removed by dialysis Acidic drugs bind to albumin and basic drugs to alpha 1 acid glycoprotein

Highyeild:

The high degree of protein binding generally makes the drug long-acting, because the bound fraction is not available for metabolism or excretion unless it is actively extracted by the liver or by kidney tubules. Glomerular filtration does not reduce the concentration of the free form in the efferent vessels, because water is also filtered. Active tubular secretion, however, removes the drug without the attendant solvent → concentration of free drug falls → bound drug dissociates and is eliminated resulting in a higher renal clearance value of the drug than the total renal blood flow The same is true of the active transport of highly extracted drugs in the liver. Plasma protein binding in this situation acts as a carrier mechanism and hastens drug elimination, E.g. excretion of penicillin (elimination t½ is 30 min); metabolism of lidocaine. Highly protein-bound drugs are not removed by hemodialysis and need special techniques for the treatment of poisoning
